{"messages":[{"role":"assistant","content":"Hello, noble dromedary (Camelus dromedarius)! The one‑humped desert specialist.

Quick facts:
- Adapted to heat: can lose ~25% body water and rehydrate fast (up to ~100 liters).
- Hump stores fat for energy; not water.
- Three-chambered foregut fermenter; eats tough, thorny plants.
- Long lashes and closable nostrils keep out sand.
- Top speed ~65 km/h; good endurance around 40 km/h.
- Gestation ~13 months; usually one calf; lifespan often 40–50 years.

What would you like—biology facts, behavior insights, differences from Bactrian camels, care/husbandry tips, or a desert-themed story?"},{"content":"What is my Camel species?","role":"user"}],"model":"gpt-5","temperature":1.0}
